div.p: This case-insensitive code system https://kip.rkkp.dk/fhir/CodeSystem/WalchClassification defines the following codes in an undefined hierarchy:

tr.td: Type A: centered humeral head, concentric wear, no subluxation of the humeral head
Type A2: major central erosion, humeral head protruding into the glenoid cavity
Type B: humeral head subluxated posteriorly, biconcave glenoid with asymmetric wear
Type B1: narrowing of the posterior joint space, subchondral sclerosis, osteophytes
Type B2: biconcave aspect of the glenoid with posterior rim erosion and retroverted glenoid
Type B3: monoconcave and posterior wear with >15° retroversion or >70% posterior humeral head subluxation, or both
Type C: Dysplastic glenoid with at least 25° of retroversion not caused by erosion
Type C1: dysplastic glenoid with >25° retroversion regardless of the erosion
Type C2: biconcave, posterior bone loss, posterior translation of the humeral head
Type D: glenoid anteversion or anterior humeral head subluxation <40°

publisher.value: Sundhedsvæsenets Kvalitetsinstitut with Trifork Digital Health A/S

name.value: Sundhedsvæsenets Kvalitetsinstitut with Trifork Digital Health A/S

Type B3: monoconcave and posterior wear with >15° retroversion or >70% posterior humeral head subluxation, or both

Type C2: biconcave, posterior bone loss, posterior translation of the humeral head
Type D: glenoid anteversion or anterior humeral head subluxation <40°
